newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: TENNIS-BIG HITTERS TO BATTLE IT OUT AT OPEN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-BIG HITTERS TO BATTLE IT OUT AT OPEN.

text.p: Two of tennis's big hitters, Goran Ivanisevic and Thomas Muster, meet at the Australian Open on Wednesday to battle for a place in the semifinals.
Number three seed Ivanisevic and fifth seed Muster had to survive long duels to get to the quarter-finals but should take some relief from forecasts that a Melbourne heatwave is about to end.
Temperatures on court of over 50 degrees Celsius forced tournament organisers to close the roof over Centre Court on Tuesday to protect players and spectators from the heat.
In other quarter-final matches, Switzerland's Martina Hingis, who is hoping to become the youngest female grand slam winner in the professional tennis era, meets Romanian eighth seed Irina Spirlea.
Hingis has been installed as odds-on favourite to win the tournament since the defeat of world number one Steffi Graf at the weekend.
Men's top seed Pete Sampras meets Spanish 10th seed Albert Costa and Belgian giant-killer Dominique van Roost will face American number 14 seed Mary Joe Fernandez.
